ratings.comment: Mark Berres, is a tremendous professor. This is not an easy class. However, if you are passionate about ornithology then you will do well naturally. Mark may have been the best professor I have had a Madison yet.
The class was too hard. The average on the first midterm was a 65 and he didn't curve it at all. Wouldn't take it again.

He's tough, but pushes you to do well and in the end it's worth it. Most people improved with each exam;physics unit was challenging and boring. He makes you think. 3 exams each with a take-home portion. He's very passionate which is inspiring. Go to lecture to do well. Exam#3 was  very interesting. Lots of material to understand. Not a lot of work

Captivating material, extreme enthusiasm and three opportunities for grading. Berres keeps it real.He encourages critical thinking and expects it on exams. While preparing for these three essay tests, make your own questions relating to the material, it will help! Study in groups as well! Enjoy being in the presence of this passionate instructor.

Pay attention to the course level. This truly is a 500 level course. Not your average sparrow here. Go to lecture unless you want to stare at a blank exam. Be warned. Otherwise, this man is a godsend! Berres shows the application of physics and math to the biology of birds. Who knew??? Also, whistle "Mockingjay" theme in class and see what happens.

Great, enthusiastic lecturer! Expect to study and think, not just regurgitate from lecture or the textbook. He is tough but helpful and friendly, especially if you go to office hours. He obviously loves birds and teaching. You really have to go to class to do well.

This was an amazing class. You learn so much about birds every class and Berres really is a wonderful professor. There is no homework, and grades are based off of two midterms and a final, which can be pretty hard. Studying is a lot of work, but its worth it for this class.

Class is strictly TA-led: Marschalek is a great choice. There's a lot of material to learn but luckily the course is extremely well-organized. Attendance is mandatory-make sure you're a morning person. Be prepared to learn ~20 new birds/songs a week! Outdoor labs are a plus. This course is awesome.

One of the best professors I have ever had! Very passionate and knowledgeable. Cool guy, great lecturer. For a 500 level class, it's not too hard - What is emphasized in lecture will be on the exam. Don't bother with the book, but take really good lecture notes, as the exams are based entirely on lecture. Very helpful if you go to office hours.

one of the best professors i had on campus. really enthusiastic, extremely helpful, and the lecture was very enjoyable. the tests are hard, but it's a 500 level course, so what do you expect? quizzes (take home) helped my grade. watching david attenborough clips was definitely a plus, too!

Mark is a decent professor.  Sometimes he gets sidetracked in lecture, and he has a weird way of speaking.  I never really decided if I liked having him or not.  His tests are difficult, but the quizzes aren't too bad.  If you read the book and go to lecture, it shouldn't be too hard.  The TA's are useless though.

Absolutely the best class and best professor ever! Definitely take this class if you have the chance. Very challenging, but this is was all course should be like. I learned a ton in this class. He is extremely smart, very excited about the topic, and always well prepared.
really stimulating prof, you can tell he loves teaching this class. the exams are a bit difficult but manageable

Really, a good professor. He knows a ton about birds, but doesn't there isn't enough time to get too technical. It's a 500 level course so expect it to show. His exams are aimed to average around 70. Definitely attend lecture that's where the answers are, the book only supplements. Take home quizzes really help the grade, too. Overall, great class!

Worst professor ever! If you feel like enjoying your life- never sign up for one of his classes.  His tests have nothing to do with anything he teaches.  Lectures are pointless- they will have nothing to do with the quizzes or exams.  You wont get grades back in time to do anyting like drop the class or learn your mistakes. YE BE WARNED!!!

He is a good teacher and a nice guy, but I hated lecture.  I felt like he took all the "fun" out of birds and reduced them down to charts and data.  You get a lot of aerodynamics, anatomy, etc.  I went into it expecting a broad survey of birds but as it's a 500 level course, it's pretty scientific.  Not recommended...take field ornithology instead.

what a fun professor! he makes birds so interesting! if you ask a question he makes sure to answer very clearly and he understands that everyone learns in different ways. and when he gets excited, he sounds like kermit the frog! the lecture is mostly theoretical stuff, and the lab (zoo 521) is actually learning all the local birds and their calls.
